body.p: McFOLEY, JAMES, Private, Co. A., 11th Pennsylvania Reserve, aged 35 years, was wounded at the battle of SpottsylvaniaSpotsylvania, Virginia, May 10th, 1864, by a conoidal ball, which passed through the scalp, grazing the left parietal bone near the sagittal suture. He was conveyed to the Mount Pleasant Hospital, Washington, and, on May 19th, was sent to the Camden Street Hospital at Baltimore. Hemiplegia of the right side had supervened. He was transferred to Annapolis, June 22d, and, on August 10th, to PittsburgPittsburgh, where he was discharged from the service, December 24th, 1864. Paralysis of the right arm still existed. He has not applied for a pension.
